title: How to Make PDFs Editable with Google Docs

steps.title: You can use Google Docs to convert a PDF to a document.
steps.content: You can use Google Docs to convert a PDF to a document. Google doesn’t have a PDF editor of its own, but you can upload a PDF to Google Drive and then open it in Google Docs. This will convert the PDF into a Google Doc that you can edit. Once you are finished editing, you can download the file again in the PDF format. While this technically makes it possible to edit a PDF in Google Docs, the process won't be as seamless as using a PDF editor .

steps.title: While you can make a PDF editable, you'll lose special formatting.
steps.content: While you can make a PDF editable, you'll lose special formatting. When Google Docs converts a PDF to a Google Doc, it will lose much of the formatting that the PDF has. PDFs that have lots of tables, charts, diagrams, and images are especially prone to losing formatting in Google Docs, and you may spend a lot of time reformatting the text, tables, and pictures. PDFs that are mostly text-based will likely convert to an editable document with minimal formatting issues.

steps.title: Upload a PDF to Google Drive.
steps.content: Upload a PDF to Google Drive. As long as you have a Google (Gmail) account , you can upload a PDF to Google Drive. Use the following steps to do so: Open Google Drive in a web browser. If prompted, sign in to your Google account. Click + New in the upper-left corner. Click File Upload . Select your PDF. Click Open . When the upload is complete, you will see "1 upload complete" in the bottom-right corner of Google Drive.

steps.title: Right-click the PDF in Google Drive.
steps.content: Right-click the PDF in Google Drive. Once your PDF is uploaded to Google Drive, locate the file. You may have to scroll down to find it. Right-click or control-click the file to display a context menu.

steps.title: Hover over the Open With menu.
steps.content: Hover over the Open With menu. When your mouse is over this context menu item, you will see some options you can use to open the file.

steps.title: Click Google Docs.
steps.content: Click Google Docs . This will convert the PDF to a Google Doc file and open it in Google Docs for editing. If the PDF contained a lot of charts, images, and special formatting, those elements may not display properly in the converted file. As a result, it may look like parts of the PDF are missing. Unfortunately, you will not be able to edit those parts in an editor like Google Docs.

steps.title: Edit the PDF as a Google Doc.
steps.content: Edit the PDF as a Google Doc. You can make whatever changes you need to make to the document in Google Docs format. You will probably need to spend some time making changes to the formatting to make it look right.

steps.title: Download the Google Doc as a PDF.
steps.content: Download the Google Doc as a PDF. Once you are finished editing the PDF in Google Docs, you can download and save a new version of the PDF. You will then find the downloaded PDF file in your Downloads folder by default. Use the following steps to download the Google Doc as a PDF: [1] X Research source Click File in the menu bar at the top. Select the Download menu. Click PDF Document (*.pdf) . If prompted, click Save or OK to start the download.

steps.title: To get the best results when editing a PDF, use a PDF editing program.
steps.content: To get the best results when editing a PDF, use a PDF editing program. Because Google Docs was not designed for PDF editing, it likely won't be the best solution for your needs. Fortunately, you can edit a PDF without altering its formatting by using programs other than Google Docs. Adobe Acrobat Pro: Use Adobe Acrobat Pro , the official PDF editor from the company that created PDF files, to add, remove, and edit text and other elements. The software is not free—you will need to subscribe to use it. Free trials are usually available. If you just need to edit a PDF once, you may be able to just use the free trial to make your edits and then cancel if you don't want to keep the software. Paid alternatives to Acrobat: For a paid alternative that allows you to buy the software once instead of subscribing on an ongoing basis, check out Master PDF Editor , PDF-Xchange , or Nitro PDF . LibreOffice Draw: This software is free and comes with LibreOffice, an alternative to Microsoft 365 (Office). You can use it to open and edit PDFs, though you may still lose some formatting (like in Google Docs). Free PDF editors: Free online PDF editors like Canva's PDF editor , SmallPDF , and PDFEscape allow you to edit a limited number of PDFs in your web browser. You can usually just use these tools to sign and fill PDFs , not edit existing text.
